feed.title: Progress on bech32 for future Segwit Versions (BIP-173)

entry.title: Progress on bech32 for future Segwit Versions (BIP-173)
entry.summary: Pieter Wuille has shared a BIP341 witness v1 address that corresponds to the generator as an inner public key. The tweak used is TapTweak(pubkey) as suggested by the BIP. He also provided the address string which reads bc1pmfr3p9 YOU j00pfxjh WILL 0zmgp99y8zf LOSE tmd3s5pmedqhy MONEY ptwy6lm87hf5ss52r5n8.Upon testing, c-lightning and Phoenix rejected the address, citing errors in parsing or invalid data. However, Green and blockchain.info accepted the address. Rusty mentions that he will continue exploring, and encourages others to do the same.
